feed.title: DevConf 2026
feed.subtitle: The premier developer conference — June 15-17, 2026 · San Francisco

entry.title: Venue Announced: Moscone Center
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce that DevConf 2026 will be held at the Moscone West Convention Center in the heart of San Francisco.

Why Moscone West

  • Central location — walking distance from BART and Muni stations
  • 50,000 sq ft of conference space across 3 levels
  • 4 simultaneous tracks in dedicated halls with excellent acoustics
  • Workshop rooms with power outlets at every seat
  • Networking areas with natural lighting and city views

Getting There

Address: 747 Howard Street, San Francisco, CA 94103

  • BART: Powell St. station (10 min walk)
  • Muni: Line 30, 45 to 4th & Howard
  • Parking: 5th & Mission Garage (2 blocks)

Hotels

We've secured discounted rates at nearby hotels:

  • Hotel Zetta — 0.2 miles, $199/night (code: DEVCONF26)
  • Marriott Marquis — 0.1 miles, $229/night (code: DEVCONF26)
  • Hotel Nikko — 0.3 miles, $179/night (code: DEVCONF26)

Book early — San Francisco hotels fill up fast in June!

entry.title: Early Bird Tickets Now Available
entry.content:
Early bird tickets for DevConf 2026 are now on sale!

Pricing

Ticket Type Early Bird Regular
General Admission $399 $599
Workshop Pass $549 $799
Student $99 $149

Early bird pricing is available until April 1, 2026.

What's Included

All tickets include:

  • Access to all talks across 4 tracks
  • Breakfast and lunch for all 3 days
  • Conference swag bag
  • Access to networking events
  • Video recordings of all talks (post-conference)

Workshop Pass additionally includes access to all hands-on workshops on Day 3.

Group Discounts

Bringing your whole team? Groups of 5+ get an additional 15% off. Contact tickets@devconf.dev for group pricing.

entry.title: Call for Proposals Is Now Open
entry.content:
We're excited to announce that the Call for Proposals for DevConf 2026 is now open!

We're looking for talks, workshops, and lightning talks across four tracks:

  • Frontend — React, CSS, WebAssembly, browser APIs, and more
  • Backend — APIs, databases, distributed systems, and architecture
  • DevOps — CI/CD, Kubernetes, observability, and infrastructure
  • AI/ML — LLMs, MLOps, data pipelines, and applied machine learning

What We're Looking For

  • Technical talks (30 min) with practical takeaways
  • Hands-on workshops (2 hours) with guided exercises
  • Lightning talks (10 min) on any developer topic

All experience levels welcome — from first-time speakers to seasoned veterans.

Important Dates

  • CFP closes: January 31, 2026
  • Notifications sent: March 1, 2026
  • Speaker confirmation deadline: March 15, 2026

Submit your proposal at cfp.devconf.dev.
